Employing more than 8,000 people, it is actively involved in education and research, management and administration, and technical and social services on a daily basis. It is one of the largest, most exciting employers in the area and offers great career opportunities. With each of its 11 faculties and more than 100 departments offering state-of-the-art study programmes that are grounded in research in a wide range of academic fields, Ghent University is a logical choice for its employees as well as its students. YOUR TASKS At least 50% of your assignment will be spent on academic research in preparation of a doctoral dissertation. This research will be in the field of evolution and diversity of nematodes and integrates all steps from fieldwork, microscopy, ecology to molecular analyses.You will assist in the teaching activities at the department (i.e. organization, counselling and assessment of practical exercises and seminars), specifically (but not exclusively) for the following courses: Nematode Morphology (C002812), Nematode Systematics and Evolution (C003672), Nematological Techniques (C003682), Entomopathogenic Nematodes: Taxonomy and Biology (C003107), Diversity of Plant-Parasitic Nematodes (C003949); Summer Course: Networking and Seminars (C003675), Soil Biodiversity and Nematodes as Bioindicators of Soil Health (C003675).You will assist in the internal and external services of the department; in particular, you will assist in the development of a digital learning environment. WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR You hold a degree of Master of Science in Biology, Master of Science in Agro- and Environmental Nematology, Master of Science in Marine Biological Resources, Master of Science in Marine Biodiversity and Conservation, Master of Science in Bioscience Engineering or a subject considered relevant by the selection committee, or equivalent. For diplomas awarded outside the European Union, a certificate of equivalence (NARIC) must be submitted.
